verses.verse: (Prov. 1:8; Eph. 6:1) Listen to your father who begot you, And do not despise your mother when she is old.
(Prov. 4:7; 18:15; (Matt. 13:44)) Buy the truth, and do not sell it, Also wisdom and instruction and understanding.
(Prov. 10:1) The father of the righteous will greatly rejoice, And he who begets a wise child will delight in him.
Let your father and your mother be glad, And let her who bore you rejoice.
My son, give me your heart, And let your eyes observe my ways.
(Prov. 22:14) For a harlot is a deep pit, And a seductress is a narrow well.
(Prov. 7:12; Eccl. 7:26) She also lies in wait as for a victim, And increases the unfaithful among men.
(Is. 5:11, 22) Who has woe? Who has sorrow? Who has contentions? Who has complaints? Who has wounds without cause? Who (Gen. 49:12) has redness of eyes?
(1 Sam. 25:36; Prov. 20:1; 21:17; Is. 5:11; 28:7; (Eph. 5:18)) Those who linger long at the wine, Those who go in search of (Ps. 75:8) mixed wine.
Do not look on the wine when it is red, When it sparkles in the cup, When it swirls around smoothly;
At the last it bites like a serpent, And stings like a viper.
Your eyes will see strange things, And your heart will utter perverse things.
Yes, you will be like one who lies down in the midst of the sea, Or like one who lies at the top of the mast, saying:
“They (Prov. 27:22; Jer. 5:3) have struck me, but I was not hurt; They have beaten me, but I did not feel it. When shall (Eph. 4:19) I awake, that I may seek another drink?”
Do not be (Ps. 1:1; 37:1; Prov. 23:17) envious of evil men, Nor desire to be with them;
For their heart devises violence, And their lips talk of troublemaking.
Through wisdom a house is built, And by understanding it is established;
By knowledge the rooms are filled With all precious and pleasant riches.
(Prov. 21:22; Eccl. 9:16) A wise man is strong, Yes, a man of knowledge increases strength;
(Luke 14:31) For by wise counsel you will wage your own war, And in a multitude of counselors there is safety.
(Ps. 10:5; Prov. 14:6) Wisdom is too lofty for a fool; He does not open his mouth in the gate.
He who (Prov. 6:14; 14:22; Rom. 1:30) plots to do evil Will be called a schemer.
The devising of foolishness is sin, And the scoffer is an abomination to men.
If you (Deut. 20:8; Job 4:5; Jer. 51:46; Heb. 12:3) faint in the day of adversity, Your strength is small.
(Ps. 82:4; Is. 58:6, 7; 1 John 3:16) Deliver those who are drawn toward death, And hold back those stumbling to the slaughter.

If you say, “Surely we did not know this,” Does not (1 Sam. 16:7; Prov. 21:2) He who weighs the hearts consider it? He who keeps your soul, does He not know it? And will He not render to each man (Job 34:11; Ps. 62:12; Rev. 2:23; 22:12) according to his deeds?
My son, (Ps. 19:10; 119:103; Prov. 25:16; Song 5:1) eat honey because it is good, And the honeycomb which is sweet to your taste;
(Ps. 19:10; 58:11; Prov. 23:18) So shall the knowledge of wisdom be to your soul; If you have found it, there is a prospect, And your hope will not be cut off.
Do not lie in wait, O wicked man, against the dwelling of the righteous; Do not plunder his resting place;
(Job 5:19; (Ps. 34:19; 37:24; Mic. 7:8)) For a righteous man may fall seven times And rise again, (Esth. 7:10; Amos 5:2) But the wicked shall fall by calamity.
(Job 31:29; Ps. 35:15, 19; (Prov. 17:5); Obad. 12) Do not rejoice when your enemy falls, And do not let your heart be glad when he stumbles;
Lest the LORD see it, and it displease Him, And He turn away His wrath from him.
(Ps. 37:1) Do not fret because of evildoers, Nor be envious of the wicked;
For there will be no prospect for the evil man; The lamp of the wicked will be put out.
